sub_title: Director at dcypher: cooperation platform for cybersecurity innovation
summary:
As Director of dcypher, I'm responsible for creating a healthy ecosystem of public-private collaborations for education, research and valorization of cyber security. I am the secretary of the dcypher board, responsible for dcypher's supporting platform bureau, coach for dcypher's innovation managers, and represent dcypher in meetings in the cybersecurity field, interdepartmental meetings and congresses. I'm known for my entrepreneurial spirit, creating creative win-win situations, and the use of my energy combined with a good sense of humor. This allows me to connect people and stakeholders, to create trust and effective collaborations. My motto is: there will always be a solution!

Specialties: Building collaborations based on combining innovation, valorization and complex technical and organizational problems,  Change Management, Operational Management Leadership, HR, Talent Development, Learning Technology, Cyber security

As HP, we enable professionals to deal physically, mentally and cognitively with their biggest challenges. Our core expertise is optimizing the performance and resilience of people who are subjected to physical and mental demands or who have to work in extreme conditions, especially people in the Defense and National Security domain. We make performance measurable in operational settings and develop interventions, training concepts, and innovative resources and equipment. With the results of our research, our clients can optimally prepare and equip their people for special, high-risk tasks. We often make use of technologies such as simulation (VR, AR), simulators, serious gaming, and AI. We use unique facilities such as the Serious Gaming lab, Climate Chambers, 3D scanning facilities, Physiological Monitoring Systems, The Neurolab, the Limosine, the Collaborative Training Centre (CTC), and the advanced motion simulator Desdemona.

I lead the development of new lines of research and innovation by means of knowledge roadmapping, strategic partnerships, and our product portfolio. I work closely together with TNO's Market Directors to ensure sufficient order intake, maximal project quality, valorization, and satisfied customers. I build connections towards new innovation and business opportunities. Originally designed for spatial disorientation training and research, the Desdemona simulator features unlimited rotations around three axes and a sustained G-force capability of up to 3G. In addition, the cabin can accelerate linearly over an 8 meter linear track. Worldwide, DESDEMONA is unique, as it combines the possibilities of both a hexapod and a centrifuge. 

In an international public-private collaboration, Austrian AMST Systemtechnik, TNO and SME multiSIM BV, work together with the Royal Netherlands Air Force, to exploit DESDEMONA for training and R&D purposes. Also, I lead the development of new lines of research by means of knowledge roadmapping, strategic partnerships, and our product portfolio. I work closely together with TNO's Business Line Managers to ensure sufficient order intake, valorization, maximal project quality, and satisfied customers. I build connections towards new innovation and business opportunities. I'm responsible for an annual turnover of >6 Meuro

As NO, we innovate networked organisations. We support them implement innovations in domains such as cyber security, cyber resilience, urban safety, security of vital infrastructures, crisis management, intelligence and national safety. We focus on understanding and improving networks â€“ in particular, the networks that are crucial to the safety and quality of life of our society. We have knowledge of the cohesion of people, organisation, processes and technology in complex organisations, and how multidisciplinary network organisations function. We study how information disseminates through networks, and how decisions are arrived at. We investigate risks and vulnerabilities, created by dependencies within networks and apply this knowledge to making improvements based on scientific and empirical findings. Our research is considered of world class excellence, enabling us to improve our networking society. 

Networked operation is not only our field of work, it is also in our nature!", 'title': 'Research Manager Networked Organisations', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Hoofddorp', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'company': 'TNO', 'description': "As Research Manager, I lead TNO's Participation and Social Cohesion group. We provide innovative solutions to increase sustainable work participation. 

Currently, the European economy experiences a significant decrease in labour potential. Our ambition is to solve this problem by providing evidence-based interventions to boost the employability and employment of inactive people at the low end of the labour market. We also investigate how we can boost the knowledge and production level of people at the low end of the labour market that may already be in paid employment but often have a low level of education and no formal basic qualification. 

Important research themes are flexibility of workforce, generation-management, elderly workers, social responsible enterprising, and the role of new media for work participation. 

Our customers are Ministries, Public employment services organization (UWV), Municipals, ZonMw, MSEs, Employment Agencies such as Randstad, etc. 

I lead the development of new lines of research and innovation, strategic partnerships, and our product portfolio. I work closely together with TNO's Market Directors to ensure sufficient order intake, maximal project quality, and satisfied customers. I build connections towards new innovation and business opportunities. Annual turnover is about 4Meuro.", 'title': 'Research Manager Participation & Social Cohesion', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 1997}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'company': 'TNO', 'description': "As a researcher, consultant, and project leader at TNO Human Factors, I'm involved in large R&D projects concerning the application of Information and Communication Technology (ICT) to improve learning processes for safety professionals such as Defence, National Police etc. 

I'm holding a Ph.D. in instructional technology and specialize in complex learning and competency-based learning by means of advanced learning technology. Much of my work is related with the integration of work and learning and ubiquitous learning.

I lead the Learning Technology Laboratory (LT-lab), TNO's expertise center for learning technology at Soesterberg. 

Furthermore, I am the manager of the Technology Group of TNO Human Factors, consisting of 14 technical specialists. Also, I plan the work capacity of 25 researchers and consultants at the department of Training Innovations. 

Finally, I provide consultancy in the change management processes required to successful implement ICT for learning in large, 24/7 organizations.", 'title': 'Researcher, Consultant and Team leader', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 7812, 'name': 'Utah State University', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHeAGY3U3E3MQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1628102031486?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=gjGJW99DFQlX6Y2CtipeKJxXyYxpgOw_vNIUBlOCPLs', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/utah-state-university/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2004}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2004}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2004}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2004}}, 'company': 'Utah State University', 'description': 'Finishing my Ph.D. thesis, about improving the development of instructional software. Three solutions are proposed in this thesis, that assist instructional designers in communicating their designs to software producers better. The first solution is to support the designers in making a better use of formal design languages to standardize their design documents. The second solution is to support the designers by using templates that offer pre-structured software moulds that only have to be filled in with learning materials to create instructional software, either as examples for producers, or even as final products. And the third solution is to support designers in reusing parts of instructional software to assemble new instructional software, as examples for producers or as final products. 

See http://e-learning.surf.nl/docs/e-learning/eddybootproefschrift.pdf', 'title': 'Ph.D. Student', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 11308, 'name': 'National Aerospace Laboratory (NLR)', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHr9q0QrsXSQA/company-logo_400_400/0/1554711775906?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=ghkLM8w3Z2ZOxNw53T97BiWW6Puth26pF42NJ8zrAtE', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/nlr/', 'employees': {'start': 501, 'end': 1000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 1997}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 1997}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 1997}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 1997}}, 'company': 'NLR - Netherlands Aerospace Centre', 'description': "Applying the Four Component Instructional Design (4C/ID) model to the Aviation domain, resulting in a set of concrete guidelines for NLR developers, as well as a demonstrator of a computer-based training program for a Flight Management System (FMS), build in Macromedia's Authorware.", 'title': 'Graduation student', 'employment_type': None}]}]
